reviews.review_msg: Stefanie is an overall good professor but it is clear that she is new to her position. She intentionally provides you with vague instructions for assignments and papers, but expects PhD level work in order to get assigned an A in the course. I consider myself to be an A-/A student but I found her difficult when grading for upper division courses

Stefanie is a new professor to teach the course, and I would say that her exams are quite fair if you put in enough effort to study the details. She takes the top iClicker marks, and she is very considerate when it comes to grading. However, since the final average was high, the curve was moved a bit. Overall, she's a reasonable professor!

Best prof Ive had so far. Shes super passionate about her material, you require an iclicker and textbook in this class as well as the novel stated in the syllabus. Her exams are all multiple choice so beware. Her lectures are fun and always interesting! She usually ends early which is a plus and shes very approachable.

Very nice and accessible outside of class - replies to emails super quick. It was her first time teaching so some may consider her monotoned and she does read directly off slides (though she does add her own info every now and then), but overall lectures were straightforward and exams were fair. Would recommend her for sure!
this course isn't as hard as she makes it. Take it with someone else if you can.
SAVE YOURSLEF AND DONT TAKE HER!! you would be better off with another prof

shes alright. Doesnt know how to teach. Her lectures (scripted) are word for word from the textbook. Makes a lot of mistake in the iclicker questions. Also makes a lot of mistakes when giving out instructions for assignment and exams.

Stefanie was great! For first time teaching (at least to a big lecture), it was clear that she put in time and effort to prepare for each class. Despite errors within I-clicker questions, she was open to hearing students out and omitting problematic questions. Great at supporting in person and email! Highly recommend!
Challenging final and lots of material covered. but i would recommend this class and the prof

She did a really great job! She was very informative and organized. iClickers every lecture but she took the top marks. If you want a good mark you have to work for it, but she is clear about what you need to do to succeed. The exams ask pretty detailed questions but isn't too bad.
shes not a good prof. Doesnt know how to teach. Monotoned. Messes up alot. Doesn't know her own material.

Stefanie is a good prof for her first time teaching, she does tend to just say verbatim the textbook material but she often adds interesting clips; one critique is that she talks way too slow, the lecture slides usually only range from 20-30 slides per section but she takes upwards of 2 hours to get through them; midterm was VERY easy

honestly shes the worst prof ever. Shes so monotoned and reads off her script the entire 3 hours. No clear grading criteria. Messes up alot during lecture and has a lot of mistakes and errors in her iclicker questions and midterms
Most condescending prof you'll ever meet. Monotoned.
